S

satisfies(Formula<RelationalAtom>) - Method in class RelationalPossibleWorld
Checks whether a formula is satisfied.
satisfies(ExistentialQuantification) - Method in class RelationalPossibleWorld
Checks whether an existentially quantified formula is satisfied.
satisfies(UniversalQuantification) - Method in class RelationalPossibleWorld
Checks whether an universally quantified formula is satisfied.
satisfiesFacts(RelationalPossibleWorld, Collection<Formula<RelationalAtom>>) - Static method in class RelationalSystemZ
Checks whether a world satisfies a set of facts (set of closed first order formulas).
saveFile(JTextArea) - Method in class GUI
Saves the content of a text area to a file.
search(TolerancePair, Set<RelationalConditional>, Set<Constant>) - Method in class SearchTolerancePairCreator
Explores a node in the search tree, representing a partially- (or fully-) built partition-pair.
SearchMinTolerancePairCreator - Class in semantics.tolerancepair
Backtracking-Search approach to create minimal tolerance-pairs.
SearchMinTolerancePairCreator(RelationalKnowledgeBase, Collection<Constant>, RelationalPossibleWorld[]) - Constructor for class SearchMinTolerancePairCreator
Creates a new backtracking-search minimal tolerance-pair creator.
SearchTolerancePairCreator - Class in semantics.tolerancepair
Backtracking-Search approach to create tolerance-pairs.
SearchTolerancePairCreator(RelationalKnowledgeBase, Collection<Constant>, RelationalPossibleWorld[]) - Constructor for class SearchTolerancePairCreator
Creates a new backtracking-search tolerance-pair creator.
selectedTPair - Variable in class Session
Currently selected tolerance-pair
semantics.ranking - package semantics.ranking
This package provides classes implementing ranking functions for propositional and first-order formulas and conditionals as well as system Z approaches to compute such ranking functions for a knowledge base.
semantics.tolerancepair - package semantics.tolerancepair
This package provides a data structure representing a tolerance-pair as well as different strategies to find tolerance-pairs for a knowledge base.
semantics.worlds - package semantics.worlds
This package provides extensions of the possible world implementations in the Log4KR library.
serialVersionUID - Static variable in class Explanation
 
serialVersionUID - Static variable in class GUI
 
session - Variable in class GUI
Session
Session - Class in gui
This class stores the data of a user session in the program, performs the offered functions on the data and produces the output.
Session() - Constructor for class Session
Creates a new session.
setButtons() - Method in class GUI
Updates the availability of function buttons based on the session status.
setConditionalPart(int, Collection<RelationalConditional>) - Method in class TolerancePair
Sets the set of conditionals for a subset.
setConstantPart(int, Collection<Constant>) - Method in class TolerancePair
Sets the set of constants in a subset.
setOutput(String) - Method in class GUI
Writes text to the output area and scrolls to the top afterwards.
setRank(Interpretation<I>, int) - Method in class RankingFunction
Sets the rank for a specific world.
setText(String) - Method in class Explanation
Sets the explanation text.
showKappa() - Method in class GUI
Writes the computed ranking function to the output area.
showKappaCSV() - Method in class GUI
Writes the computed ranking function spreadsheet-optimized to the output area.
showKB() - Method in class GUI
Writes the currently loaded knowledge base to the output area.
showTPairs() - Method in class GUI
Writes the created tolerance-pairs to the output area.
switchOutput(boolean, Explanation) - Method in class GUI
Switches between the text output area and the tree control used to show detailed query evaluations.
syntax - package syntax
This package provides all syntactic structures needed in addition to Log4KR, that is a data structure for first-order knowledge bases as well as other classes for formulas and groundings.
SystemZ - Class in semantics.ranking
System Z calculates a unique minimal ranking function for a propositional conditional knowledge base.
SystemZ(Collection<Conditional<PropositionalVariable>>) - Constructor for class SystemZ
Creates a new instance of System Z for the given knowledge base.
